intro: Pedicularis sparsissima, commonly known as the sparse beard vetch, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
